activity.activity: Received message from Joe Castilo, Adjuster @ Travelers Insurance. Returned his call at 916-638-6623. He stated claim was recently accepted on 11/11/13 as to back, which is what we are claiming. However, they are objecting to treatment by Dr. Marshall Lewis as he is not withing Travelers MPN. MPN can be accessed at WWW.MYWCINFO.COM. He also stated that he doesnt have a copy of our rep letter or application. I will go ahead an email to jcastilo@travelers.com. Will discuss change of PTP with JRR.
Emailed copy of application and rep letter to adjuster Joe Castilo @ Travelers
11-21-13 Rcvd defenses objection to ptp and MPN information. Saved in DB
Left message on VM for tt. Need to inform him claim has been admitted and I will be switching his ptp.

Client returned my call. I informed him his claim has been admitted and that we are going to have to switch him to a ptp w/in the MPN. He advised me that he went to an appt with Dr. Lewis this past Friday at which point they informed him the MRI was denied. He stated they gave him the names/numbers of two different doctors who are w/in travelers MPN. He is going to call me back with their info.

Rcvd call back from clients wife, she provided the following two possible drs that are within Travelers MPN

Dr. Andre P. Edmonds Visalia Medical Clinic Inc 5400 W Hillsdale Ave Visalia, CA 559-738-7542

Guadagni, James R., MD Visalia Medical Clinic Inc 5400 W. Hillsdale Ave. Visalia, CA 559-738-7550
If no return call from client, f/u with him re: info on mpn drs given to him by Dr. Lewis. [Due 11/22/2013].
If no return call from client, f/u with him re: info on mpn drs given to him by Dr. Lewis. [Due 11/22/2013].
Prepared and Mailed 4600 Ltr w/P.O.S. to adjuster Joe Castilone. Elected Dr. Andre P. Edmonds. Upon confirmation of authorization to treat, I will contact Dr. Edmonds to set appt.

Received phone call from client His SDI has been stopped. They've informed him its because claim was admitted by carrier and they should be paying TD. I advised him this was correct. Let him know carrier has authorized treatment with Dr. Andre P. Edmonds and that I would be setting appt today and letting him know. He understood.

Received phone call from client. He was following up on appt with Dr. Edmonds. Followed up with Dr. Edmonds office as I had previously left a message. I spoke with Christina who informed that I first needed to fax her all prior medical reports to her. Dr. Torres, the managing doctor, would review the case and decide whether or not they would take on clients care. She stated they needed at least a week to review records and make decision. Faxed all medical records to Christina. Let Mr. Robles know of situation. He will follow up with me in a week.
Follow up with Christina at Dr. Edmonds office re appt for client. [Due 12/03/2013].
Follow up with Christina at Dr. Edmonds office re appt for client. [Due 12/03/2013].
Phone call to Dr. Edmonds office. They declined taking on the clients treatment. Going to have to find him another doctor on the MPN
Adrian Robles v. Mor Furniture For Less

Message.subject: Adrian Robles v. Mor Furniture For Less
Message.body:
Hi Joe, 

Please recall that I was attempting to transfer this client into the MPN with Dr. Andre Edmonds, which you authorized. Unfortunately,  Dr. Edmonds declined taking on the applicants care as PTP. As such I am once again browsing through the MPN list to find him a doctor. I will advise you of who we elect so you can send written authorization. Thank you!

Halley Cuevas, Hearing Representative/Legal Assistant

Message.subject: Adrian Robles
Message.body:
Hi Amy,

Here are are the Minutes of Hearing for the status conference that was held today. Judges secretary updated EAMS to show the correct date of injury. Please update on Merus. We tentatively agreed to use Dr. Dhalla as AME. I will be sending out a confirming letter to defense.  You may want to call client and let him know about AME.  You might also want to warn him that if he applies for State disability, he will be held liable to pay them back because hes already been released by his PTP Dr. Riddle. Thanks!

--

activity.contact-name: Adrian Robles (1444 Olympia Ave, Tulare, CA 93274, (323) 542-5906)
activity.activity: Phone call to client. He wanted to stop by and discuss his case. Told him as long as he is here before 4PM he can come in today. He understood.

Client came in to see me yesterday afternoon. He stated that last week he called Amy 15 times in a row and she didn't answer. He stated he left her several messages with no call back. I told him Amy was no longer with our office and that I was handling his case again. He was happy about that. He had several questions about his case. He received a 5k check with a notice of PD and I advised him that they have started advancing him money from his settlement. I advised him that 5k and any money received going forward was going to be deducted from his case. He stated the PD notice indicated he had 11% PD and wanted to know where they got that from. Told him it was based on the AME report of Dr. Dhalla. He asked how the doctor determined that if he didn't even review the MRI. I printed the AME report and reviewed it with him. We received the AME report in September in which the AME requested the MRI and Surgical consult report. This should have been sent asap and Amy didnt send it till last week. I told him that the PD percentage will probably change so that we need to wait on the supplemental. Also, he stated the corporate office called him and indicated that they were going to be offering him a job within the restrictions given to him by the doctor.

Phone call to client, re: return call.

Spoke to him.

He's saying that he is having back problems again.

As he is sitting down at work, he's saving a lot of problems.

They are trying to provoke him....

He's seeing Dr. Miller...
- He's off of work....this doctor took off of work.

Phone call to client, re: off work.

Client was taken off work by the doctor. He was then contacted by the employer and told that he had to come Back to work or he would be fired. I advised him to give me a copy of the off work order, and to go back to work.

I thereafter advised him, to please call me when he faxed over the off work order so that I could call someone at the workplace.

Message.subject: Adrian Robles - MSCTomorrow 2-9-15 Judge Thorne
Message.body:
John,

This matter is set for MSC tomorrow morning before Judge Thorne. FYI, THE CLIENT WILL BE PRESENT TO FACILITATE SETTLEMENT. I reviewed the file and I did send out a settlement demand based on the AME report of Dr. Prabhu Dhalla. The report didn't rate very high , 10% PD which equals $5,913.88 which shows the decrease since the employer did accommodate him back at work. However, the AME stated he is going to need 3 different surgeries to the back, a laminectomy, discectomy and possible fusion. Because of that and all of the additional medical care he will require if he decides to undergo the procedures in the future, I made the demand at $150,000 C&R. The client is willing to resign his position with the employer. Fyi the defense attorney is Sandy Quesda. She's actually a hearing rep and she is a b***h. The last hearing was taken off calendar because we had just received the supplemental from the AME where he reviewed the MRI's and addressed FMC since that was not addressed in the initial report. It is in the 11/4/14 supp report that Dr. Dhalla recommends surgery. At the last MSC, she was adamant about setting it for trial or stipping the case. I argued for a continuance because we had just received the report from Dr. Dhalla and the client wanted to discuss the recommended surgery with his PTP. So Judge Thorne granted the continuance and that is how we are now set for an MSC again. Client doesn't want to Stip, he wants to C&R and resign.  He expressed interest in the Voucher. Exhibits are on disc and I placed the disc with a POS on your desk so you can hand to defense. There really aren't any issues to try since we went to an AME.

Halley Cuevas, Hearing Representative/Legal Assistant
THE RAMIREZ FIRM
Granville Business Center
7121 Magnolia Avenue, Suite M
Riverside, CA 92504

Message.body:
DIVISION OF WORKERS' COMPENSATION

WORKERS' COMPENSATION APPEALS BOARD

 

NOTICE OF HEARING

 

 

DATE OF SERVICE:09/19/2014

 

WCAB CASE NBR(s):ADJ9103169

 

EMPLOYEE: ADRIAN ROBLES

 

EMPLOYER:MOR FURNITURE FOR LESS

 

INSURER:TRAVELERS SACRAMENTO

 

TYPE OF HEARING:MSC

 

DATE OF HEARING:12/18/2014 THURSDAY

 

TIME OF HEARING:08:30 A.M.

 

LENGTH OF HEARING:

 

LOCATION:RIV-ADJ

3737 MAIN STREET

RIVERSIDE/CA/92501

 

Map available at: http://www.dir.ca.gov/dwc/dir2.htm

 

JUDGE:David Thorne

951 782-4269

 

You are hereby notified that the above entitled case is set for hearing before the Division of Workers' Compensation of the State of California. Continuances are not favored and will be granted only upon clear showing of good cause. Please arrive before scheduled appearance time.

 

NOTICE TO PARTIES: Disability Accommodation is available upon request. Any person with a disability requiring accommodation at the Hearing should contact the Disability Accommodation Coordinator at the District Office of the WCAB, or the state-wide Disability Accommodation Coordinator at 1-866-681-1459 (toll free) as soon as possible.

 

Deaf/hard of Hearing/Speech Impaired: Any person who requires an assistive listening system or computer aided transcription system, should contact the Disability Accommodation Coordinator at the District Office or the WCAB, or the state-wide Disability Accommodation Coordinator, through the California Relay Service, by dialing 711 or 1-800-735-2929 (TTY) or 1-800-855-3000 (TYY-Spanish), as soon as possible, or no later than five (5) days before the hearing. The Division will provide a sign language interpreter upon request.

 

Vision Impairment (Alternate Formats): This notice can be made available in Braille, large print, computer disk, and tape cassette as a reasonable accommodation for an individual with a disability. Please contact the Disability Accommodation Coordinator.

 

NOTICE TO INSURER : The employer will not receive Notice of Hearing.

 

SPECIAL COMMENTS/INSTRUCTIONS:

 

WC01

activity.activity: Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less, re: Trial

Message.subject: Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less, re: Trial
Message.body:
Ryan:


I hope this finds you well.


I will not be appearing at the trial on Wednesday as I will be in Bakersfield for a previously continued trial.


I will however, have an attorney appearing, ready to go (if need be), but will be asking to continue the matter.


I simply intend to call APPLICANT (who I have subpoenaed) and the defense attorney to state that I had a proposed C&R for the exact amount that you settled the case for....


I don't think I'm being unreasonable asking for something, while you're unwilling to even entertain the thought.


Nevertheless, I assume Adrian will not show, although he was served, and that will, in and of itself, provide the good cause to continue the trial.


Just wanted to give a heads up.


I hope the Holidays trated you and yours well.




Regards,
John R. Ramirez, Esq.

Review of case file, and supplemental AME report, re: phone call to client.
Minutes of Hearing 08/02/16
4-4-17. Status Conference
File was opened for a total of 1379 days The Ramirez Firm total of 558 Days (09/19/13 to 03/30/15)New AA total of 821 Days (03/01/15 to 06/29/17)
Called def atty and spoke to Atty Eric he will have his secretary email me a copy of the OA C & R
07-31-17.LFD. Reg Atty Fees
6-29-17. ORDER APPROVING C&R
Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less, re: Settlement of Lien
I called AA Ryan 213 381-4367 and left a VM for him

Ryan called me back and said we got paid on the stip and we never opened filed a petition to re open, he offers us $300.00I ecplained to him we had 70K on the table as well but client changed his mind and wanted to stip, he said if we have anything in paper confirming that also he said we have gotten paid on the stip
Re: Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less, re: Settlement of Lien
9-7-17. NOTICE OF STATUS CONFERENCE
Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less, re: Call to New AA
I called AA back Atty Ryan 213-381-4367 and left him a VM reg fees, per JRR we will accept 50% of the 70K atty fees since we had the 70K already prior to client retaining him
Per AA Ryan he will go to hearing next week and set for trial, he said we got paid on the stip and we don't deserve anything
I called AA and left him a VM reg this afternoons hearing, asked him to set it for an MSC not trial
Robles, Adrian v. Mor Furniture For Less (7)
11-10-17.Trial Briefing Reg Division of Atty Fees
